headline.main: 3 Career Diplomats Picked For Ambassador Posts

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 12 -- With the help of the armed forces, President Jorge Pacheco Areco has apparently won a battle with a rebellious Congress that threatened to plunge this small nation into chaos.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 12 -- With the help of the armed forces, President Jorge Pacheco Areco has apparently won a battle with a rebellious Congress that threatened to plunge this small nation into chaos.
docs.abstract: Pacheco, with help of army, apparently wins battle with Cong as it backs down from demand that he rescind July 26 decree mobilizing striking bank workers into army; little indication seen that mil leaders have interest in seizing power for themselves but ability of Pacheco to maintain his position without their active support seen unlikely; Pacheco critics hold he has assumed far more power than warranted; defenders hold nation would suffer econ collapse without measures he has instituted; nation's econ problems discussed; prospects for lifting of ltd state of siege seen remote

headline.main: Uruguay's Congress Avoids Clash With President

byline.original: By MALCOLM W. BROWNESpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 15 -Twelve men armed with submachine guns took over a radio station today in Sao Paulo, Brazil's largest city, and broadcast an attack on the military Government of President Arthur da Costa e Silva.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 15 -Twelve men armed with submachine guns took over a radio station today in Sao Paulo, Brazil's largest city, and broadcast an attack on the military Government of President Arthur da Costa e Silva.
docs.abstract: 12 armed men take over Sao Paulo radio station for 12 mins to broadcast attack on Govt

headline.main: Rebels in Brazil, Shifting Attacks to Cities, Denounce Costa on Seized Radio

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Aug. 23 (AP) -Pink Pigeon, a roan mare carrying top weight of 123 pounds, led throughout today and won the $54,900 Matron Handicap at Arlington Park by a head.
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Aug. 23 (AP) -Pink Pigeon, a roan mare carrying top weight of 123 pounds, led throughout today and won the $54,900 Matron Handicap at Arlington Park by a head.

headline.main: Pink Pigeon Beats 31-1 Shot by a Head in $54,900 Matron at Arlington; EGLOGA IS SECOND TO $11.60 VICTOR

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES -- A simple side trip from Buenos Aires to Montevideo, across the River Plate in neighboring Uruguay, can be as complicated as booking an itinerary from New York to Europe, so bewildering are the number of rates and varied the routings....
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES -- A simple side trip from Buenos Aires to Montevideo, across the River Plate in neighboring Uruguay, can be as complicated as booking an itinerary from New York to Europe, so bewildering are the number of rates and varied the routings. For the 143-mile trip, there is a choice of no fewer than 14 international airlines, three ferries, a hydrofoil and two connecting bus lines on the Uruguayan side.
docs.abstract: 14 internatl lines offer service for 143-mi trip between Buenos Aires and Montevideo, Uruguay; service described; illus

headline.main: Shopping Around to Cross the River Plate

docs.snippet: CHRISTMAS is approaching, and with it will come many stamps commemorating the birth of Christ. The United States single 6-cent stamp, recently announced and illustrated here, will be of a Maine winter scene and will be a multicolored adhesive having...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHRISTMAS is approaching, and with it will come many stamps commemorating the birth of Christ. The United States single 6-cent stamp, recently announced and illustrated here, will be of a Maine winter scene and will be a multicolored adhesive having its first day sale on Nov. 3 at Christmas, Fla.
docs.abstract: US stamp commemg 1st man on moon to have 1st day sale on Sept 9

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 31 -Brazil and Mexico, the two Latin-American countries with the largest national markets, have agreed to promote joint industrial ventures and stimulate trade.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 31 -Brazil and Mexico, the two Latin-American countries with the largest national markets, have agreed to promote joint industrial ventures and stimulate trade.
docs.abstract: Brazil-Mex accord on trade promotion opens new possibilities for formation of Latin-Amer common mkt; obstacles to such mkt discussed

headline.main: BRAZIL TO EXPAND MEXICO TRADE TIE; 2 Nations Sign Accord for Joint Industrial Projects

byline.original: By JUAN de ONISSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 3 (UPI) -- The Government drafted about 10,000 employes of private banks in the interior into the armed forces today in an effort to break the two-month-old bank strike.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 3 (UPI) -- The Government drafted about 10,000 employes of private banks in the interior into the armed forces today in an effort to break the two-month-old bank strike.
docs.abstract: Govt drafts 10,000 employes of private banks in interior into armed forces in effort to break 1-mo-old strike; less than half of 3,500 workers in Montevideo have returned to work as result of similar move; Cong has declared decree unconst, Pres Pacheco Areco had defended its legitimacy

headline.main: Uruguay Drafts Employes Of Banks to Break Strike
